## **Description**
The **Date Diff **operator allows to subtract a time interval from an input date.

## **Input**
**Input**

**Data type**

**Description**

**in0**

Date

The date from which you want to subtract a time interval

**in1**

Number

The quantity of time, in the unit of measure defined in the settings, to subtract from the input date.

## **Output**
**Output**

**Data type**

**Description**

**out0**

Number

The resulting date, after the operator subtracted the specified time interval from the input date

## **Settings![](data:image/png;base64,)**
- From the **Format **drop-down menu, select the format to use for the output date.

> Tip

Click![](data:image/png;base64,) (**Add item**) at the bottom of the drop-down menu to add a custom value to the list, then click ![](data:image/png;base64,) to confirm.\

![](data:image/png;base64,)

- From the **Locale **drop-down menu, select the preferred locale settings that the operator will use when returning the output date.

> Note

By selecting the "Default" option, the operator will use the locale settings defined at runtime.

- From the **Difference in **drop-down menu, select the unit of measure to use for the time interval that the operator will subtract from the input date.

- Click **Apply **to confirm.

## **Special cases**
In special cases, the operator behaves as follows:

**Case**

**Behavior**

**Input is INCONSISTENT with expected data**

The operator returns an empty string. The system logs a warning event.
